title: China: Citi Supports Schools in Guizhou Province
summary: Guiyang - Citibank (China) Co. Ltd (Citi) announced today its Guiyang branch has provided funding in support of establishing libraries or electronic libraries in seven primary and secondary schools in three counties of Guizhou province in Western China. Citi worked with the China Friendship Foundation for Peace and Development and the Guizhou Provincial People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries to implement the program. Paul Ouyang, Branch Manager of Citi Guiyang, Hu Jianhuai, Secretary General of China Friendship Foundation for Peace and Development, and Chen Guode, Acting Vice Chairman of Guizhou Provincial People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries, attended a donation ceremony in Guiyang.
tag-1: China: Citi Supports Schools in Guizhou Province
tag-3: Guiyang – Citibank (China) Co. Ltd (Citi) announced today its Guiyang branch has provided funding in support of establishing libraries or electronic libraries in seven primary and secondary schools in three counties of Guizhou province in Western China. Citi worked with the China Friendship Foundation for Peace and Development and the Guizhou Provincial People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries to implement the program. Paul Ouyang, Branch Manager of Citi Guiyang, Hu Jianhuai, Secretary General of China Friendship Foundation for Peace and Development, and Chen Guode, Acting Vice Chairman of Guizhou Provincial People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries, attended a donation ceremony in Guiyang.
tag-4: Paul Ouyang said, "Citi was first international bank to be open a full-service branch in Guiyang, and we are committed to playing an active role in supporting the ongoing development of Guiyang and its surrounding areas. We are delighted to support this library project, which is helping young students who are in particular need of books and knowledge in order to improve their outlook in life."
tag-5: With the support of China Friendship Foundation for Peace and Development and Guizhou Provincial People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries, Citi Guiyang has equipped five schools with around 16,000 books and furniture, and established two electronic libraries furnished with computers and Internet access.
tag-6: "We are grateful to Citi for its generous support. Guizhou is a relatively underdeveloped province in China, and this initiative will make a real difference in the lives of local students attending these schools," said Hu Jianhuai, Secretary General of China Friendship Foundation for Peace and Development.
tag-7: Citi first opened a branch in Guiyang in 2010 and works closely with local companies in and around the city and also retail customers to provide banking and wealth management services.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-10: Citi China  Citi first established an office in China on May 15, 1902, in Shanghai. In April 2007, Citi was among the first international banks to locally incorporate in China. Citi's locally incorporated entity is known as Citibank (China) Co Ltd, which is wholly owned by Citibank N.A. Today Citi is a leading international bank in China, and has thirteen corporate bank branches - in Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Tianjin, Chengdu, Hangzhou, Dalian, Chongqing, Guiyang, Nanjing, Changsha and Wuxi- and forty-eight consumer bank outlets. With operations in more than 160 countries around the world, Citi is the most global of all international banks in China.
